body:
hey guys i need a little help please

What should I include in a code. "Php" to send a simple text to another android device with "whatsapp"?
but without using the "tests / whatsapp.php". I need to build the code from 0

obviously using "require "../src/php/whatsprot.class.php"

because I really do not understand much, would greatly appreciate your help

comment_data.body:
thank you so much but i have a little problem lol ...
 $w->Message('ID', 'NUMBER', 'TEXT');

ID: A unique ID e.g. time().'-1' hmm i can't understand this ... sorry :/
is the timezone??

and, can i send messages to myself to test?

You just put `time().'-1'` there, it should be unique enough.

And yes you can send a message to yourself.

Better take your UDID out there.. But it worked for me using your details.

What does happen if you try to send the message?
hmmm can u send me a message with these code? for try please?
Sent you some Pakistan Location
works! but not in my laptop :( I need to have an open port? I have router

No you should not have to open any ports. I am not sure what your problem might be :(

Is there any error message or something? Could you try running it using CMD / Terminal?

well ... in firefox by appserv ... says nothing
and in CMD is 

php C:\appserv\www\wa\test\whatsapp.php
no?

and in cmd says "php_mbstring is missing" and check and if there
you know "teamviewer"? You can access my laptop through this program please. is very important to me

might be my version of appserv with php5?

Could you first navigate to the folder test using `cd`?

Then just run `php whatsapp.php`

I am sorry but I can not use Teamviewer or something like it at the moment.

yes i can navigate to the folder using cd and i try php whatsapp.php and says an error  "php_mbstring.dll is missing"
and in the console say: 

"PHP warning: php startup: Unable to load dynamic library 'C:/appserv\php5\ext\php_exif.dll'
and in php.ini i have uncomment php_mbstring and php_exif :S

problem solved with CMD error, look at a website and said you had to change the order of call in the php.ini.

just now running but still not send the message.

Could you try adding a `sleep()`at the end? I think `sleep(3)` should be enough.
This should ensure, that the message is completely sent.

nothing ... I think I have bad luck, I will try to reinstall or install "php6" thank you very much anyway.

one last question, you use appserv, wampp, xampp?
I am using xampp for local testing.

@developrch @gerswin @kirthar Thank you so mucho guys! now works...

install "Xampp" and tried the new code they gave me and it worked perfectly!

I thought if you install linux not working with "xampp" but it was not necessary, but apparently does not work with "AppServ."

thank you very much, saved me! problem solved!

The last question...

I can send more than one person the message? and can i send special characters... áéíóú??
how?

Do you mean the same message to more than 1 person or a group message to many person?

On the first case you just need to use the $w->Message( x, y, z ); many times changing the number.
On the second scenario look here https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/pull/55 or here https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/10 

I had no problems with special characters.
Damn forgot that Login and Connect stuff, because it is all in my own wrapper :/ Sorry man!

@kirthar thank you that was what I needed.

@developrch no problem and thank you very much also because you lost your time to help me
how to send message through whatsapp using php

how can i get full tutorials for this problem???
pliiissss

How? You can start by reading other issues, looking into exampleFunctional.php or offer some guy some money and hope for the best.

Full tutorial is already in the second post:
https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/108#issuecomment-9256407
That's all there is to it.

title: Send simple text
